derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: from French récidiviste, from récidiver 'fall back', based on Latin recidivus 'falling back', from the verb recidere, from re- 'back' + cadere 'to fall'

entry.tran: 屡教不改的罪犯;惯犯;累犯
entry.def: A recidivist is someone who has committed crimes in the past and has begun to commit crimes again, for example after a period in prison.

example.ex: Six prisoners are still at large along with four dangerous recidivists.
example.tran: 4个危险的惯犯和其他6名犯人仍然在逃。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who is repeatedly arrested for criminal behavior (especially for the same criminal behavior)
2. someone who lapses into previous undesirable patterns of behavior

auth_sentence.content: Most of the recidivist smokers were puffing again within two months.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most of the recidivist smokers were puffing again within two months.

auth_sentence.content: His original calling of journalism, while perhaps not lucrative, has a history of absorbing the occasional recidivist.
